body:
Comment 4: 
http://golang.org/ref/spec#Constants
"A constant may be given a type explicitly by a constant declaration or conversion, or
implicitly when used in a variable declaration or an assignment or as an operand in an
expression."

Since '13' is an operand in the expression that could be interpreted as int64, that
should trigger implicit conversion.  The fact that explicit conversion produces equality
would seem to confirm that theory.
